intro: Crocanthemum nashii, commonly known as the Nash's crocanthemum, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a humid, temperate climate. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
